abstract: Tigers rewrite the script in toppling the Yankees in the Bronx, while the National League's two Game 5s rate differently on the panic meter and the White Sox raise more eyebrows by hiring Manager Robin Ventura.
snippet: Tigers rewrite the script in toppling the Yankees in the Bronx, while the National League's two Game 5s rate differently on the panic meter and the White Sox raise more eyebrows by hiring Manager Robin Ventura.
lead_paragraph: For a while, the Tigers-as-Yankee-slayers became a plausible idea. The Tigers have the best pitcher in baseball, a shrewd manager, cool old-school uniforms. But when they botched a chance to win the American League division series at home in Game 4, a trip to the Bronx for Game 5 Thursday night was a no-hoper. You don't let the Yankees off the mat and win. You just don't.

headline.main: Leading Off: That Wasn't Supposed to Happen
